required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Working IVF Patients' Quality of Life
clinical_study.official_title: Working IVF Patients' Quality of Life

brief_summary.textblock:
Infertility affects approximately 1 in 6 couples and may require the use of Medically Assisted Reproduction techniques. In France, there were more than 60,000 in vitro fertilization (IVF) attempts in 2016. The burden of the IVF process is even more significant for working women, causing significant absenteeism due to medical appointments but also to the psychological discomfort caused by the management (Bouwmans et al., 2008). Unfortunately, there are no studies that specifically address the quality of life of working women undergoing IVF.
Our cohort project aims to measure quality of life using validated questionnaires (FertiQoL, STAI Anxiety Scale and BDI Depression Inventory) in active patients who are scheduled for a first IVF attempt. Quality of life will be measured before starting treatment and at embryo transfer and will be followed up at each embryo transfer for a maximum period of 18 months. The follow-up will end after the live birth of a child or at the end of the 18 months of follow-up.
We will also evaluate, by means of a specific questionnaire, the satisfaction with the interactions between professional and private life (management and consequences of absenteeism at work, consequences on professional evolution, anxious repercussions in the professional and private domains) in the active women undergoing IVF treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the evolution of the quality of life of active patients during their IVF course.
primary_outcome.description: Assessed by FertiQoL questionnaire score at 18 months or end of follow-up, compared with the one obtained at inclusion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Look for predictive factors of impaired quality of life.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in quality of life score (FertiQoL) between baseline and follow-up visits

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess work/life interactions and their relationship to quality of life.
Look for predictive factors of dropout.
secondary_outcome.description: Anxiety scale score (STAI trait at baseline only, STAI state for all visits)

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare the characteristics of patients who achieve pregnancy versus those who fail (QOL, anxiety, depression (QOL, anxiety, depression...)

intervention.description: The quality of life questionnaire will be completed before starting the treatment and then during the embryo transfer and will be followed up at each embryo transfer over a maximum period of 18 months. We will also evaluate by means of a specific questionnaire the importance of work/life interactions management and consequences of absenteeism at work, consequences on professional evolution, anxious repercussions in the professional and private domains).

study_pop.textblock: Active women, aged between 18 and 42, undergoing IVF at Montpellier University Hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Professionally active women aged 18 to 42 years
- Beginning in vitro fertilization treatment at the Montpellier University Hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who have already had an IVF attempt in the process of egg donation or pre-implantation diagnosis
- History of psychotic or dissociative disorder
- Not fluent in French
- Not affiliated to a social security system
- Protected by law or under curators/guardianship
- No record of non-objection to participate in the study
